poem:
Title: A Publisher's Bargain

Pecker confessed 
before robed judges,
bought McDougal's tale
not for ink but for silence.
Life's theatrics unfolded, yet
no pages fluttered,
no typewriter sang.
Quiet stung like a winter frost,
preserved only
for the Trump campaign.
Oh, to sacrifice truth
on the altar of politics,
each secret, a dagger drawn. 
A story buried,
A voice dimmed,
In the name of ambition.
